descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: French 115-1 is the first course of a two-quarter sequence (Fall and Winter) that covers the same material as the three-quarter sequence of French 111, but which assumes some prior knowledge of the language. The aim of the course is to review and develop skills in speaking, understanding, reading, writing and cultural competence.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Students who have studied French for more than one year in High School before should enroll in 115-1 (Fall) and 115-2 (Winter). Students are required to take the Northwestern Online French Placement Test (http://placement-test.mmlc.northwestern.edu).

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Classes meet four times a week (MTWTh) and will include a variety of activities designed to help students review and develop their knowledge of basic French vocabulary and structures along with the ability to use what they have learned in communicative activities. Classes will be conducted exclusively in French except when explanation of grammar or other material may necessitate the use of English. Students are expected to prepare outside of class, to participate actively in class activities, and to work independently with the En Avant! online listening program and Internet activities.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Final grades are based on class participation and attendance, homework, compositions, a class presentation, quizzes, two unit tests, and a final oral exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Anderson, Dolidon, En Avant!, second edition. McGraw Hill, 2016.
